name: spiked
content:
spiked adjective
(POINTED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
with a sharp point or points: spiked helmets Spiked railings are being installed around the building. The plant has many spiked leaves.
Spiked hair sticks up in thin narrow points. : He's got pink spiked hair.
More examplesFewer examplesWith her piercings, spiked dog collar, and mohawk haircut, she looked a little intimidating.He fell back into a spiked fence and injured his back.I think the spiked hairstyle really suits her.

spiked adjective
(DRUGGED)
(of a drink) having had a drug added to it, so that the person who drinks it becomes unconscious, extremely tired, or unable to function normally: She was given a spiked drink and then sexually assaulted.
More examplesFewer examplesDark nightclubs mean a spiked drink can still be difficult to detect.She could have been raped if she had not been warned about her spiked drink.
